001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003/**
004 * A pauseable daemon thread which will can be required to go into a waiting
005 * state after each execution of the loop. This is basically a thread which
006 * executes a while loop, with pause, resume and halt functions.
007 *
008 * The thread will repeatedly call doLoop() until isComplete() is true, or the
009 * thread is halted. If the thread is paused, it will wait until unpaused or
010 * halted. Once complete or halted, it will call shutdown() and exit.
011 *
012 *
013 */
014public abstract class PauseableThread extends Thread {
015
016        volatile boolean halt = false;
017        volatile boolean pause = false;
018
019        volatile boolean waiting = false;
020        volatile Object trigger = new Object();
021
022//      private Thread shutdownHook;
023
024        /**
025         * Constructor. This creates a daemon thread with the given name and
026         * priority. If the name is null, the default thread name is used. If the
027         * priority is less than or equal to 0, the default thread priority is used.
028         */
029        protected PauseableThread() {
030                this(null, -1);
031        }
032
033        /**
034         * Constructor. This creates a daemon thread with the given name and
035         * priority. If the name is null, the default thread name is used. If the
036         * priority is less than or equal to 0, the default thread priority is used.
037         *
038         * @param name     the name of the thread, or null to use the default thread
039         *                 name
040         * @param priority the priority of the thread, or a value less than or equal
041         *                 to 0 to use the default thread priority
042         */
043        protected PauseableThread(String name, int priority) {
044                super();
045                this.setDaemon(true);
046                if (priority > 0) { this.setPriority(priority); }
047                if (name != null) {
048                        this.setName(name);
049//              shutdownHook = new Thread() {
050//                      public void run() {
051//                              PauseableThread.this.halt();
052//                      }
053//              };
054//              Runtime.getRuntime().addShutdownHook(shutdownHook);
055                }
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Repeatedly called while the thread is not paused or halting. This can
060         * interact with resources shared with other threads but needs to be
061         * synchronised on them (or use non blocking). This operates equivalent to a
062         * `while (!isComplete()) {doLoop();}`
063         */
064        public abstract void doLoop();
065
066        /**
067         * Threads can be halted by calling this method. This will cause the thread
068         * to exit its loop and proceed to shutdown. If the thread is currently
069         * paused, it will be unpaused to allow it to exit. If the thread is already
070         * complete, this does nothing.
071         */
072        public void halt() {
073                this.halt = true;
074                this.unpause();
075        }
076
077        /**
078         * Signify the thread loop is complete and can proceed to shutdown. This is
079         * checked even if the thread is paused.
080         *
081         * @return true if the thread loop is complete and the thread should proceed
082         *         to shutdown, false otherwise
083         */
084        public abstract boolean isComplete();
085
086        /**
087         * Check if the thread is currently waiting in a paused state. This can be
088         * used to check if the thread is paused, but can also be true if the thread
089         * is in the process of pausing (i.e. it has executed pause() but has not yet
090         * entered the waiting state). Note that this does not necessarily mean the
091         * thread is paused, as it could be in the process of resuming (i.e. it has
092         * been unpaused but has not yet exited the waiting state).
093         *
094         * @return true if the thread is currently waiting in a paused state, false
095         *         otherwise. Note that this can be true even if the thread is not
096         *         paused, if it is in the process of pausing.
097         */
098        public boolean isWaiting() { return this.waiting; }
099
100        /**
101         * Threads can pause themselves but will never unpause (unless halting). If
102         * the thread is complete this does nothing.
103         */
104        public void pause() {
105                if (!this.isComplete()) { this.pause = true; }
106        }
107
108        /**
109         * Run the thread. This will repeatedly call doLoop() until isComplete() is
110         * true, or the thread is halted. If the thread is paused, it will wait until
111         * unpaused or halted. Once complete or halted, it will call shutdown() and
112         * exit.
113         */
114        @Override
115        public void run() {
116                this.setup();
117                while (!this.halt && !this.isComplete()) {
118                        if (!this.pause) { this.doLoop(); }
119                        while (this.pause && !this.isComplete() && !this.halt) {
120                                this.waiting = true;
121                                synchronized (this.trigger) {
122                                        try {
123                                                this.trigger.wait();
124                                        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
125                                                this.halt = true;
126                                        }
127                                }
128                                this.waiting = false;
129                        }
130                }
131//              Runtime.getRuntime().removeShutdownHook(shutdownHook);
132//              shutdownHook = null;
133                synchronized (this.trigger) {
134                        this.trigger.notifyAll();
135                }
136                this.shutdown(this.isComplete());
137                return;
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * Run on thread once at the start. Can setup thread local resources.
142         * Constructor can be used to set up shared resources.
143         */
144        public abstract void setup();
145
146        /**
147         * Shutdown the thread. This must close down any resources and exit without
148         * error.
149         *
150         * @param completedNormally did the loop complete or was the thread halted?
151         */
152        public abstract void shutdown(boolean completedNormally);
153
154        /**
155         * Get the approximate current status of the thread. This can be "running",
156         * "pausing", "paused", "resuming", "halting", "halted" or "complete". Note
157         * that the thread can be in the process of pausing or resuming, so the
158         * status may not always reflect the current state of the thread.
159         *
160         * @return the current status of the thread
161         */
162        public String status() {
163                if (this.isComplete()) { return "complete"; }
164                if (this.halt && this.getState().equals(State.TERMINATED)) {
165                        return "halted";
166                }
167                if (this.halt) { return "halting"; }
168                if (this.pause && !this.waiting) { return "pausing"; }
169                if (this.waiting && !this.pause) { return "resuming"; }
170                if (this.waiting && this.pause) { return "paused"; }
171                return "running";
172        }
173
174        /**
175         * Non blocking unpause a thread. Nothing happens if the thread is not
176         * paused. Otherwise the thread will be woken up and resume executing
177         * doLoop() repeatedly, until isComplete() is true, or told to halt.
178         */
179        public void unpause() {
180                this.pause = false;
181                synchronized (this.trigger) {
182                        this.trigger.notifyAll();
183                }
184        }
185}
